title: Zimbabwe Developers for Cardano
description: As blockchain becomes the default tech to solve local problems, lack of competent Cardano devs will become an issue unless addressed now

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great plan to bring on more Cardano developers in Zimbabwe. THe biggest issue is the voters have no idea how many this funding is inteded to bring on. Compare this to "African Blockchain Centre for Devs" which is asking for 37,500 which with train up 25 devs.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal lacks a clear outline of exactly what is being done. There is a  plan to run a series of hackathons, there also seems to be a course developed by mot neccesarily run and a stake pool made. what are the number of people of people to be drawn into these. Without that key detail, how can successful implementation be judged?
f6_assessments.q2: TO be truly auditable, this proposal really needs to have a goal for the number of participants in the hackathons. Otherwise what are voters getting for their money. Its also not clear what the stakepool is for, who will own/run that post proposal?

f6_assessments.q0: Creating developer local developer community around Cardano by way of conducting free personalized training is likely enhance awareness and interest. However, six weeks of training in Haskell and Plutus is quite shot and only experience developers might be able to absorb such a short time Haskell Course. Business outreach and 4000USD for stake pool setup are in the scope of the proposal. The resason for setting up stake pool at this cost is not clear.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have claimed a strong team in their website with organizational capability. There is the limitation of expertise in the education field or software development which I feel can be hired at the required time.
f6_assessments.q2: The developer outreach proposal has only 3K USD allotted out of 30K for course development. The scope of the Hackathon is should include Plutus/Haskell/Blockchain project. The output is likely to increase in awareness of Cardano and buildup of Community in Zimbabwe, which will be difficult to measure in analytical terms and is likely to be difficult to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: This team presented a clear plan on how to increase the local developer ecosystem of Zimbabwe. This is critical for Cardano adoption in this region as there is a lack of skilled blockchain developers. This will positively affect the local community. As one part of this challenge is to support initiatives that help to grow our developer ecosystem, this proposal is within this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this proposal is well-established in Cardano and Catalyst. Projects of WADA have been voted on several time. They have already build a strong community around Africa and are an important part of bringing Cardano to Africa. The presented plan is well-thought and covers all important aspects like market research, detailed roadmap with different activities and a clear timeline. The budget is very detailed and furthermore well explained. From my perspective it is fair priced and reasonable. In addition the team has already a plan for long-term funding to get independent from Catalyst funding. Overall, this proposal is very mature and ready to be executed.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has set clear milestones with related metrics which help us to audit this proposal. Also they have reflected potential challenge in many details and already have established some measure to overcome/avoid them. The only aspect that could be more clear, is where/how the community can observe the ongoing activities (something like a documentation source).

f6_assessments.q0: Training new devs to utilize the functionalities of the Cardano ecosystem off course is an excellent way to help developers succesfully build on it. I also like the focus on decentralisation and on African countries, which additionally helps fulfill some of the other objectives.
f6_assessments.q1: WADA has very well credentials and is behind many credible projects. Also the additional credentials provided are explaining the relations of the project team. The plan is very detailed and thought through and shows that this project has indeed been well-planned and is likely to succeed.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones and objectives have been clearly set, making it easy to audit the progress and success of the project. Good work!

f6_assessments.q0: Certainly, the impact on the developer ecosystem would be greatly improved by this proposal, which is one of the best I've seen, to be honest. There are clear definitions of success and how the Cardano ecosystem will be affected positively.
f6_assessments.q1:
I have not only high expectations that given the talent collected the proposal will be promptly implemented and realized, but I have high hopes as well. 
A detailed definition of people that will be working on the proposal as well as their exact background was provided in the proposal. 
I loved to see such passionate plans for the future of the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal has all components a good business proposal needs and more on top of it.
There are explicit timetables explaining in detail the roadmap of the whole project as long as a very well-thought-out plan in accordance with the situation in the country.
The budget being asked for is totally acceptable if not too small for the endeavor being undertaken.
f6_assessments.q2:
Given all the information it will be really easy to track the progress of this project and I'll be doing so in the months to come because I'm sure this will be one of the proposals that are sure to make it to funding.
Clear KPIs we're given and the budget matches the plan presented in the proposal.
Best of luck to you!

solution: Bring local Zimbabwe devs on a discovery journey of the Cardano protocol through hackathons, training and dApp design.
experience: WADA: Skilled team of Cardano Community practitioners and entrepreneurs, located in hubs across Africa and the diaspora
